description: Anonymous. Fols. 104; 19.3 x 14.2 cm.; written surface 15.5 x 9 cm.; 17-21 lines to page; in naskhi; with catchwords; headings in red. An anthology containing besides the selections from al-Badr al-Sāfir the following: (1) A poem in praise of Christ and the Apostles, dated A.D. 1714, by al-Khūrī Nīqūlāwus. (2) Muʻashsharāt [decastichs] al-Fāzānī al-Maghribī, poems arranged according to the alphabetical order of their rhyme. (3) al-Qaṣāʼid al-farāyid al-maḥbūkāt al-Ṭarafayn [The Unique Odes with Well-bound Ends], by Ṣafī al-Dīn al-ḥillī A.H. 677-750 [A.D. 1278-1349/50]. The verses of this Ode are arranged in the alphabetical order of their rhyme. (4) The Badīʻīyah of Ṣafī al-Dīn al-ḥillī. (5) Two verses of the Badīʻīyah of ʻAbd al-Raḥmān ibn Muḥammad ibn Yūsuf al-ʻAlawī A.H. 860-920 [A.D. 1455/6-1514/5]. Beg.: من قول بعضهم ىرثي احد خلانه وىظهر معاىب الدنىا وضعف امل اصحابها Ending: فمذ ارى نظري برقا اراق دمي * من طىبة لم اطق ىوما ارى قدم Marginal notes and glosses. On the page before title page occur the title by a later hand, an obliterated name dated A.D. 1771 and the autograph of an owner, al-Muṭrān Aghābiyūs. On the inside of the front cover the contents of the book are set forth. The end is lacking. MS in good condition but several folios worm-eaten; modern Arabic binding. Acquired from Brill, Leyden, A.D. 1900.
title: Majmūʻah shiʻrīyah muntakhabah min al-kitāb al-mashhūr al-musammá al-Badr al-sāfir ʻan uns al-musāfir...
